title: Don’t believe those who claim science proves masks don’t work

last_post.content:
So, I wrote about *that* mask study. We need to stop giving so much air to bad faith actors. Their goal is to exhaust us and numb us into losing empathy and giving up. Masks protect ourselves and our communities. Let’s put that science into action.

#COVID

It can empathize and imagine what you know
separately from what it or others knows

title: A new study about seabirds and offshore wind turbines may surprise you

last_post.content:
A new study about seabirds and offshore wind turbines may surprise you.

A two-year, €3 million study of seabirds at an offshore wind farm off Scotland combined radar data with cameras to identify the species of seabird and create a three-dimensional image of birds’ flight patterns and how they avoid offshore wind turbines’ rotor blades.

The study’s findings: Not a single collision between a bird and a rotor blade was recorded.

https://electrek.co/2023/03/02/seabirds-and-offshore-wind-turbines-vattenfall/

title: Alaska Says It’s Now Legal “in Some Instances” to Discriminate Against LGBTQ Individuals

last_post.content:
When Alaska rolled back its protections for LGBTQ people, it didn't send out a press release.

Instead, the state quietly announced the policy change via the social media feeds of its human rights commission.

The agency's Twitter and Facebook accounts had a total of 102 followers as of yesterday.

New, from @ProPublica & Anchorage Daily News:

https://www.propublica.org/article/alaska-drops-lgbtq-discrimination-ban?utm_medium=social&utm_source=mastodon&utm_campaign=mastodon-post

#Alaska #LGBTQ #CivilRights #HumanRights #SCOTUS #Employment #Discrimination #Housing #Credit

title: PressThink: Bill O'Reilly and the Paranoid Style in News

last_post.content:
I have been writing about Fox and what makes it different for 20 years. http://archive.pressthink.org/2003/10/21/oreilly_voice.html

Two days ago, Josh Marshall wrote about Fox the best short form description and analysis I have ever read.

Marshall has a history PhD. As he says, "it’s worth stepping way, way back, not just to the beginning of Fox News in 1996 but to the beginning of the broader countermovement it
was a part of..."

No essay I know of puts it all together like his.

https://talkingpointsmemo.com/edblog/the-deep-archeology-of-fox-news/sharetoken/WKLM5YQ0yue5

#uspol #journalism

title: IPLC Letter to the Office of Science & Technology Policy

last_post.content:
Update. The statement is now on the #HarvardLibrary website.
https://library.harvard.edu/about/news/2023-03-03/iplc-letter-office-science-technology-policy

Another excerpt: "We want to highlight the dangers of allowing the interests of commercial #publishers to dictate the paths available to [#OpenAccess]…We refer here to the…#APC (article processing charge)…and/or institutional #ReadAndPublish agreements where libraries pay bulk APCs on behalf of their scholars and unlock institutional access to read pay-walled content."

title: sciencedirect.com/science/arti...

last_post.content:
I’m a co-author on a new paper out in The Lancet - part of the Lancet Commission’s ongoing work.

It traces the evolving dynamics of the anti-vaccine movement from the “Jenny McCarthy crunchy left” that many remember, to a networked activism movement with strong ties to right-wing identity. It describes the increasing tactical reliance on online harassment as well.

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0140673623001368

title: machine-learning-notes/pandas2-pyarrow.ipynb at main · rasbt/machine-learning-notes

last_post.content:
I love Pandas! I've been using it ever since I started doing machine learning more than a decade ago.

Now that the Pandas 2.0 release candidate is out, I was just taking the new PyArrow backend for a test drive. It's a significant boost over the original NumPy backend.
For string manipulation, it even seems faster than polars.

Code for reference here:
https://github.com/rasbt/machine-learning-notes/blob/main/benchmark/pandas-pyarrow/pandas2-pyarrow.ipynb

#python #programming #machinelearning

It’s become cliché to observe such hypocrisy, but once again: this sort of corruption would be used by US agencies to manipulate other nations. citizensforethics.org/reports-investigations/crew-investigations/trump-sold-his-dc-hotel-gop-spending-disappeared/

title: On the Sanctity of Touch - Cole Haddon - Medium

last_post.content:
NEW ESSAY: On the Sanctity of Touch

We take touch for granted…until it’s gone.

This is one of the most personal things I've shared on Medium, but also, I think, one of the most universal -- especially in the wake of COVID.

Read here: https://medium.com/@cole.haddon/on-the-sanctity-of-touch-480468f1c594

#life #death #lifelessons #family #COVID #COVID19 #grief #love

title: Never use a URL shortening service - even if you own it

last_post.content:
some random thoughts on decay of historical twitter data:

* all those old threadreader "unrolls" are gone
* all the storify collections too
* lots of those shortlinks are now broken or point to sites that are scammy, spammy or untrustworthy (c.f. https://shkspr.mobi/blog/2023/02/never-use-a-url-shortening-service-even-if-you-own-it/ )

i don't know if i agree with the above post that there's a high risk of this being used for evil, but it's pretty easy to search your twitter data and delete, say, all gu dot com links en masse

title: The Next Deadly Pandemic Is Just a Forest Clearing Away

last_post.content: "The next deadly pandemic is just a forest clearing away. But we’re not even trying to prevent it." https://www.propublica.org/article/pandemic-spillover-outbreak-guinea-forest-clearing "Models have shown that the more patchy a forest gets, the more edges are created at the borders of clearings where virus-carrying animals can come into contact with humans, until so much forest is cut down that it can’t sustain wildlife anymore. The theoretical model encapsulates this concept to assess risk by considering the amount of “edge” produced by deforestation"

title: Dr. Valerie L. Thomas: The Face Behind Landsat Images

last_post.content:
Meet the woman behind early @NASA_Landsat images: Dr. Valerie L. Thomas.

A self-taught programmer, she managed the development of Landsat image processing. Her work in the '70s helped show that satellite imagery could be used to support agriculture. https://www.nasa.gov/image-feature/dr-valerie-l-thomas-the-face-behind-landsat-images/ #BHM

title: La CNIL appelle à des évolutions dans l’utilisation des outils collaboratifs états-uniens pour l’enseignement supérieur et la recherche | CNIL

last_post.content:
Amis de la fonction publique d'État, si on vous pose la question...

En #France, les suites collaboratives #Microsoft #Office 365 et #Google #Workspace sont proscrites dans les services de l'État.

Les bases réglementaires :

→ Note de la CNIL (27/05/2021) : https://www.cnil.fr/fr/la-cnil-appelle-evolutions-dans-utilisation-outils-collaboratifs-etatsuniens-enseignement-superieur-recherche

→ Circulaire 6282-SG (05/07/2021) et note (15/09/2021) : https://acteurspublics.fr/upload/media/default/0001/36/acf32455f9b92bab52878ee1c8d83882684df1cc.pdf

→ Ministre de l'Éducation Nationale, en réponse à une question écrite (2022) : https://questions.assemblee-nationale.fr/q16/16-971QE.htm

#droit #juridique #numerique

title: gofundme.com/f/help-fox-and-ze...

last_post.content: Being trans online is watching everyone else have to do crowdfunding until you're the one doing it, and it's my turn. This is a moving fund one of my friends set up for me. WHAT THIS WILL ALLOW ME TO DO: Move out of the Bay Area, which has no housing mobility, and is an increasingly-untenable living situation. Moving to Philly will allow me to get better healthcare as a trans person, move in with my partner, and be in proximity to a support network. https://www.gofundme.com/f/help-fox-and-zelda-move-in-together

title: Remembering David Malmberg

last_post.content:
We are informed that David Malmberg, the creator of the Adventure Game Toolkit (AGT), passed away last weekend.

https://intfiction.org/t/remembering-david-malmberg/60778
https://www.echovita.com/us/obituaries/ca/orange/david-malmberg-16032498

AGT was one of first wave of hobbyist IF development tools that followed the commercial success of Infocom.

title: A Dutch doctor and the internet are making sure Americans have access to abortion pills

last_post.content: Note that this Dutch abortion pill website is literally #1 on the ISP blocklist in the recently released Texas bill. We're right on the doorstep of the conversation about the role of censorship circumvention tools deployed in repressive regimes, for American Internet users. Also, U.S. ISPs may about to be in the crosshairs of a #NetNeutrality fight, and it's not going to be the usual one where we bicker over economic zero-rating schemes to supplement oligopoly profits. https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/dutch-doctor-internet-are-making-sure-americans-access-abortion-pills-rcna35630

title: The Fallacy of AI Functionality

last_post.content:
The Fallacy of AI Functionality
“Deployed AI systems often do not work. They can be constructed haphazardly, deployed indiscriminately, and promoted deceptively. However, despite this reality, scholars, the press, & policymakers pay too little attention to functionality. This leads to technical & policy solutions focused on “ethical” or value-aligned deployments, often skipping over the prior question of whether a given system functions, or provides any benefits at all.” https://dl.acm.org/doi/fullHtml/10.1145/3531146.3533158

title: Cleaning Up Tables from Primary Sources in ChatGPT

last_post.content:
I have deep concerns about the rise of large language models but am also interested in exploring concrete use cases on assumption they are here to stay.

One thing ChatGPT can do quite well is clean up messy table data. This is useful for historians working with complex tables in scanned historical documents. I offer an example in this post:

https://froginawell.net/frog/2023/03/cleaning-up-tables-from-primary-sources-in-chatgpt/

#chatgpt #LLMs #histodons #asianists

title: Facebook Is Better for Business Than Mastodon. Here's Why

last_post.content:
#MastodonNews Mar 4, 2023

So, this is fun. We are their worst nightmare. Turn's out Mastodon "falls short for businesses" because it lacks "advertising support," says an ad industry publication.

CMSWire: Facebook Is Better for Business Than Mastodon. Here's Why >>> https://www.cmswire.com/digital-marketing/facebook-is-better-for-business-than-mastodon-heres-why/

"Social media has become one of the most powerful tools businesses can leverage for advertising... Mastodon, on the other hand, does not offer an advertising platform to businesses."

😂

#twittermigration

title: Writing - Foundations - Human Interface Guidelines - Design - Apple Developer

last_post.content:
Loved the Apple HIG "Writing" guide: https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/foundations/writing/

Via @stern: https://mastodon.social/@stern/109961894927064285

Anyone who writes text for UIs should read that.

And it linked to something even better, Apple's guide to inclusive writing, that *everyone* should read: https://support.apple.com/guide/applestyleguide/intro-apdcb2a65d68/web

The craft of making great apps depends SO MUCH on good writing.
